entries.meaning: The act of replacing the wires of something

verbs.description: rewire (third-person singular simple present rewires, present participle rewiring, simple past and past participle rewired)

entries.meaning: To replace or reconnect the wires of a device or installation.
examples: I had to rewire the circuit where the old wires had shorted out.
The electrician said that we couldn't add a new outlet without rewiring.

entries.meaning: To change the functionality of something by altering the parameters or logic.
examples: When our companies merged, I rewired our payment processing system to handle their invoices as well.
